intro: Wahlenbergia marginata var. neocaledonica, commonly known as the New Caledonia marginated bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat. It has slender stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the stems. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its beauty.
